editionStmt.edition: Edition created from new transcripts of this manuscript.

respStmt.resp: Initial upload of this work's facsimile images and metadata to FromThePage.com for editing
Adminstrator of the Stagville Accounts transcription project on FromThePage.com
made 301 edits between February 25, 2016 and February 14, 2019.
made 24 edits between February 27, 2019 and February 27, 2019.
made 15 edits between January 12, 2017 and February 27, 2019.
made 5 edits between March 22, 2016 and March 22, 2016.

sourceDesc.p: Accounts of Stagville Plantation Store from August 1808.

p.head: 69 William Horton Self Dr
69 Sarah Cozart PP Wm Horton Dr
70 James Daniel Self Dr

div.note: Sarah Cozart -- first woman I've seen transacting business at the store. Also doesn't have her own account, but is under William Horton's. (Wonder what their relationship was.)
Baxter's transactions are odd -- "self PP self" PP usually means "buying on behalf of" but he's buying on behalf of himself? Maybe just a "typo"?
categorized Moulds as a kitchen implement, but thinking maybe not now. Could it be for brickmaking? Would go with "pipes" for building? Do you have an "unknown" category? (Need a place to put it!)

p.head: 70 Capt. William Ray Self Dr
70 Josiah Stephenson Self Dr
70 William Roberts Jr PP Order Dr
70 Michael Carey Self Dr.
Entd in Memo John Roberts (of Geo) PP Order Dr.
70 Charles Roberts Self Dr

div.note: not sure what the little ~ mark is. A unit of measure, but one that fits equally well with pepper and powder...

I'm struggling to interpret "John Roberts (of Geo) PP Order Dr." in the second-to-last issue. There is some relationship between John Roberts and George Roberts, but I'm not sure whether George is buying something on John's account, John is buying something on George's account, or something else is happening.

p.head: Stagville August 12th 1808
70 Ephraim Roberts Self Dr.
70 General Charges To Ephraim Roberts Dr.
70 Frederic Moize Self Dr.
70 Archer Harris PP son Williams Dr.
70 Jeremiah Roberts PP Son Dr
70 Allen Moize Self Dr.
70 Hugh Cain Self Dr.
70 James Roberts Self Dr.

div.note: Not sure the 2nd Ephraim Roberts entry here is right. And should we link Wm Roan? Probably?
Many commodities ("coal" "snuff") that I didn't know where they want I put in "miscellaneous". You may want to move them.

div.note: I'm interpreting "Drawing Knife" to mean a drawknife, rather than a knife for drawing.
I also categorized "draw knife" as "Hardware", though perhaps it should have been under "knives"?

div.note: I marked all the hkfs as hankerchiefs (2 types). Steel, Slate and ink well went into miscellaneous.
Hey big spender! Who was this Elijah Patterson, and who was in his household that received so many nice things in such a short period of time? And where did the money come from?
